lead_paragraph: Forty-six-year-old Morten Andersen is returning to the Atlanta Falcons after Michael Koenen failed in his attempt to do all the kicking. Andersen, the second-leading scorer in N.F.L. history, last played in 2004, when he kicked for the Minnesota Vikings. He will handle extra points and field-goal attempts except those well beyond 50 yards. Koenen, who made just two of eight field-goal attempts in Atlanta’s first two games, will continue to handle the kickoff and punting duties. Andersen played for Atlanta from 1995 to 2000.
